result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Blake C. Sprang

records.addlTxt:
3:27 PM - Defendant Blake C. Sprang appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Adam J Snavely appeared by video for Blake C. Sprang.  Prosecuting attorney Anthony A. Lambrecht appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant waives their right to a preliminary hearing.  Defendant is bound over to Circuit Court Branch 2 for trial. Inducement received 8-22-22.
ARRAIGNMENT - 
Information filed.  Copy served on defense counsel.
Not guilty plea(s) entered.  Jury calendar.
Further proceedings scheduled for September 30, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Scheduling conference scheduled for January 25, 2023 at 09:00 am.
Scheduling conference on January 25, 2023 at 09:00 am.
Further proceedings on September 30, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant in custody.   
Defendant demands a preliminary hearing.   Preliminary hearing is set for 08-24-22 at 2:30 p.m.    
Minutes.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt:
Initial appearance is reset to 08-15-22 at 1:30 p.m. to allow public defender more time to appoint counsel.   
Minutes.

ADDRESS INFO for Blake C. Sprang
Current: 2164 S. 21st Street, Manitowoc, WI 54220   (Effective: 07-15-2022)
Prior: 1416 Marshall St, Manitowoc, WI 54220

BAIL HEARING - 
Defendant in custody and appearing by video from the Manitowoc County Jail.  The State informs the Court that the defendant will be charged with the crimes of possess Fentanyl, possess drug paraphernalia and possess THC-2nd.  The matters are continued for initial appearance on 07-18-22 at 1:30 p.m. Br. 1.  Bail is set at $2,500.00 recognizance bond with the conditions that he have no contact with Jessican Fenlon and Kathryn Schmidt and maintain absolute sobriety.   Bail furnished and defendant is remanded into custody on PO hold. 
Minutes.
